'Boring tha': Rohit Sharma's Offbeat Humour at Champions Trophy Presser Goes Viral

Date: NEW DELHI
Source: Times of India

During the squad selection press conference, Indian captain Rohit Sharma lightened the mood with his humorous comment, which quickly gained traction online.

  • Rohit Sharma quipped about the press conference being boring.
  • Ajit Agarkar, the chief selector, smiled in response, adding to the light-hearted atmosphere.
  • The event announced India's squad for the ODI series against England and the Champions Trophy 2025.
  • Key players like Yashasvi Jaiswal and Harshit Rana received their maiden call-ups.
  • Mohammed Shami and Kuldeep Yadav returned from injuries, while Jasprit Bumrah's fitness remains a concern.
“Boring tha PC,” says Rohit Sharma, highlighting his humorous side during the announcement.

This light moment is a reminder of the importance of humor in high-pressure situations, exemplified by Rohit Sharma's wit.

title: Rohit confirms availability for Mumbai's Ranji game - Cricbuzz
summary:
Rohit Sharma Confirms Participation in Upcoming Ranji Match

Date: Sat, Jan 18, 2025 | Source: Cricbuzz

Rohit Sharma has announced his availability for the Ranji Trophy match scheduled from January 23-26 against Jammu & Kashmir, marking his return to domestic cricket after nearly ten years.

  • Rohit's last Ranji match was in November 2015, at the same Wankhede venue.
  • His confirmation came during the Champions Trophy squad announcement.
  • Rohit expressed confidence in managing the transition between formats.
  • He joined the Mumbai team for practice ahead of the match.
  • Other international players are also participating in domestic matches as per BCCI directives.
“Yes, I will play,” Rohit confirmed about his Ranji match involvement.

The announcement is significant as it reflects a trend where top players are engaging in domestic cricket to support their state teams, in line with BCCI expectations.

title: New bird flu vaccine development gathers pace amid fears of pandemic - The Times of India
summary:
New Bird Flu Vaccine Development Gathers Pace Amid Fears of Pandemic

Publication Date: [Publication Date] Source: Times of India

Amid fears of a bird flu pandemic in humans due to the rise in bird flu cases, the federal government is accelerating efforts in developing new vaccines, including mRNA shots, with a $590 million commitment to Moderna.

  • The US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has intensified bird flu vaccine development.
  • An mRNA vaccine is being prioritized for its ability to be developed quickly.
  • $590 million has been committed to Moderna for fast-tracking vaccine production, in addition to a previous $176 million investment.
  • 67 confirmed human cases of bird flu have been reported in the US, with one death.
  • Research funding is also being allocated for antivirals and monoclonal antibodies to combat bird flu.
“Accelerating the development of new vaccines will allow us to stay ahead and ensure that Americans have the tools they need to stay safe.” - HHS Secretary Xavier Becerra

The development of new vaccines for bird flu is critical in ensuring public safety and preventing a potential pandemic, as current vaccines may not be sufficient during a health crisis.
newTitle: New Bird Flu Vaccine Development Gathers Pace Amid Fears of Pandemic

title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: ‘Sinauli excavations must answer Dalits’ role in Dravidian culture’, says Vasugi Bhaskar - The Hindu
summary:
The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: ‘Pre-marital sex is frowned upon but marital rape is legal’, says Leeza Mangaldas

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The first day of The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 began with vibrant discussions featuring various authors and speakers addressing key societal issues. Notably, Leeza Mangaldas made headlines with her statements about marital rape and societal attitudes towards sex.

  • Leeza Mangaldas emphasized how pre-marital sex is frowned upon while marital rape remains legal in India.
  • Historian Peter Frankopan discussed the significance of the moon’s gravitational pull in human and animal reproduction.
  • Dr. Abraham Verghese highlighted the power of novels to transcend time.
  • Conversations included the influence of Tamil poetry in modernity, featuring insights from prominent literary figures.
  • Upcoming sessions are expected to cover diverse topics including literature, LGBTQ rights, and climate change.
“We live in a country where pre-marital sex is frowned upon, but marital rape is legal,” – Leeza Mangaldas.

The event presents an opportunity for deep engagement with contemporary issues, inviting audiences to rethink societal norms and values.
newTitle: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 Highlights: Controversial Discussions and Insights

title: NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova - Free Press Journal
summary:
NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova

Published on: Saturday, January 18, 2025, 06:44 PM IST

This article discusses a stunning new image released by NASA, showcasing the remnants of the supernova Cassiopeia A as captured by the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).

  • The image is a result of JWST's capabilities to capture both visible and infrared light.
  • Cassiopeia A is the remnant of a massive star that exploded, creating a shockwave.
  • The image reveals details comparable to an onion's layers, as described by a member of the science team.
“We were pretty shocked to see this level of detail,” said Jacob Jencson of Caltech/IPAC, principal investigator.

This breathtaking image highlights NASA's ongoing efforts to explore and capture celestial wonders, showcasing the advancements of the JWST.
newTitle: NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova

title: Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home's doorbell camera | Watch viral video | Today News - Mint
summary:
Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home’s doorbell camera | Watch viral video

Date: September 2023 | Source: Live Mint

A rare moment was captured on camera in Charlottetown City, Canada, when a rock from space fell to Earth. A doorbell camera on a Canadian home recorded the meteorite hitting Earth as it crashed into a walkway.

Key Points:

  • The incident occurred in July last year.
  • A couple returned home to find their walkway littered with debris.
  • The meteorite was confirmed to be of interstellar origins by the University of Alberta.
  • It marked a significant first in meteorite documentation with both video and sound.
  • The space rock has been named Charlottetown.
“As far as we know — it is the first time that a meteorite falling to Earth has been recorded on video, with sound,” said Chris Herd, geologist.

This unique event offers new insights into meteorite strikes and has generated significant interest.
newTitle: Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home’s doorbell camera | Watch viral video

Rohit Sharma Set to Play in Next Ranji Trophy Round while Kohli and Rahul Out

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

India captain Rohit Sharma has confirmed his participation for the next round of the Ranji Trophy matches starting January 23. Kohli and Rahul will not be available due to injuries.

Kohli, Rahul Not Available for Ranji

Rohit missed two Tests in Australia due to poor form but aims to boost his performance in the domestic circuit. Kohli and Rahul are ruled out due to medical issues.

  • Rohit Sharma: Confirmed to play in the next Ranji Trophy round starting January 23.
  • Kohli and Rahul: Both players cited injuries, ruling them out of the upcoming matches.
  • Injury Details: Kohli is dealing with neck pain, while Rahul has an elbow issue.
Kohli: 'I am still experiencing pain, ruling me out of the match.'

title: Arvind Kejriwal’s car attacked by BJP workers during campaigning, alleges AAP; BJP denies involvement - The Hindu
summary:
Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers, Claims AAP

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The AAP has alleged that Arvind Kejriwal’s car was attacked during an election campaign, claiming the attackers were BJP workers.

  • The AAP released a video showing a group of people waving black flags and throwing stones at Kejriwal's car.
  • BJP leader Parvesh Sahib Singh countered that the crowd was attempting to ask questions to Kejriwal, and some youths were injured by his vehicle.
  • Police stated that no stones were thrown at the car, and the individuals waving flags were swiftly removed.
“Supporters of BJP’s New Delhi candidate Parvesh Verma attacked Kejriwal during campaigning in the constituency,” an AAP leader said.

Concluding, this incident highlights the rising tensions and allegations between AAP and BJP amidst a charged political atmosphere.
newTitle: Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers, Claims AAP

title: Delhi Polls: Kejriwal Announces 'Gamechanger' Free Electricity, Water Scheme For Tenants - News18
summary:
Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: News18

With the Delhi Assembly elections approaching, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal announced a significant policy guaranteeing free electricity and water for tenants, aiming to support his party's electoral campaign.

  • Kejriwal guaranteed free electricity and water for all tenants if AAP is re-elected.
  • The announcement is particularly aimed at benefiting Purvanchali residents, who represent a significant tenant population.
  • He emphasized the current inequalities faced by tenants who do not receive similar benefits as homeowners.
  • This announcement comes on the heels of BJP's manifesto release, pushing AAP to bolster their campaign promises.
“Across Delhi, we have provided free electricity and water to residents. However, it is unfortunate that tenants do not get these benefits.” — Arvind Kejriwal

This scheme reflects AAP's continued focus on welfare initiatives, especially for vulnerable communities as they seek to secure votes in the upcoming elections.
newTitle: Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections

Rasha Thadani enjoys an Uyi Amma moment with Tamannaah Bhatia and Vijay Varma, who the star kid calls her ‘adopted parents’

Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rasha Thadani, daughter of Raveena Tandon, recently debuted in the film industry with her movie Azaad. The screening saw support from her close friend, Tamannaah Bhatia, who praised Rasha's song Uyi Amma. The duo later showcased their chemistry as they danced together on the said track.

  • Tamannaah Bhatia, a close friend, has emerged as Rasha's biggest supporter, referring to her as her 'adopted mother.'

“When Aaj ki raat meets Uyi Amma ❤️❤️🙌”

title: Emergency, Azaad box office collection day 2 early estimates: The Kangana Ranaut starrer expected to see - TOI Etimes
summary:
Emergency and Azaad Box Office Collection: Day 2 Estimates

Publication Date: January 17, 2023 Source: Times of India

The release of Kangana Ranaut's film Emergency and Abhishek Kapoor's Azaad led to a competitive box office situation. Initial estimates suggest Emergency may see increased collections over the weekend.

  • Emergency: Opened with Rs 2.5 crore on Friday and earned Rs 1.19 crore by Saturday afternoon.
  • Total collection for Emergency as of Saturday afternoon stands at Rs 3.69 crore.
  • Azaad: Collected Rs 1.5 crore on the first day but is expected to drop, with only Rs 52 lakhs collected by Saturday afternoon.
  • Pushpa 2 continues to maintain strong competition with a collection of around Rs 1 crore on its 44th day.
“The good word of mouth for Emergency suggests a rise in collections, especially with a holiday approaching.”

The performance of both films showcases the competitive nature of the current box office landscape.
newTitle: Emergency and Azaad Box Office Collection: Day 2 Estimates

title: SIT widens probe into mysterious deaths in Budhal Rajouri - Greater Kashmir
summary:
SIT Broadens Investigation into Mysterious Deaths in Budhal Rajouri

Date: January 18, 2023; Source: KINS

The 11-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) has expanded its probe into the deaths of 16 individuals in the Badhal area of Rajouri district over the past 45 days, raising concerns in the local community.

  • The SIT, led by Superintendent of Police (Operations) Budhal, Wajahat Hussain, is exploring all possible angles in the case.
  • Initial reports suggested the presence of neurotoxins in samples collected from the deceased, but further analysis is pending.
  • Four daily diary reports have been filed detailing the mysterious fatalities.
  • Among the deceased were a man and his four children, indicating the depth of tragedy impacting multiple families.
  • The SIT is considering the possibility of foul play and evaluating all evidence and leads.
“We are questioning individuals and reviewing evidence collected from the area. Our goal is to uncover the truth and deliver justice to the grieving families,” said a member of the SIT.

The SIT is closely collaborating with health department teams to uncover the root cause of the deaths, urging the affected community to stay calm as the investigation progresses.
newTitle: SIT Broadens Investigation into Mysterious Deaths in Budhal Rajouri

title: RG Kar rape case verdict live: CBI demands maximum punishment for Sanjay Roy - Hindustan Times
summary:
RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Demands Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The RG Kar rape case has concluded with the court finding accused Sanjay Roy guilty of the rape and murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor. A significant outcry followed the case, leading to nationwide protests for justice.

  • The victim was discovered dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024, after being raped.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police, was arrested after police identified him via a Bluetooth device found near the crime scene.
  • The case fueled widespread protests by junior doctors demanding better security measures in hospitals.
  • The trial commenced on November 12 with Judge Anirban Das overseeing proceedings that involved 50 witnesses and concluded on January 9.
The CBI's lawyer stated, “We demanded maximum possible punishment for Sanjay Roy.”

The case has raised significant concerns over safety in medical facilities and the need for more robust legal actions against such heinous crimes.
newTitle: RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Seeks Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

title: Arvind Kejriwal's car attacked by BJP workers, says AAP; Parvesh Verma makes big counterclaim - The Times of India
summary:
Arvind Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers, Says AAP; Parvesh Verma Makes Big Counterclaim

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has reported that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's car was attacked by BJP workers during a recent public event.

  • The incident occurred during a visit to a local area where Kejriwal was attending a function.
  • AAP leaders condemned the attack, claiming it reflects the growing intolerance from rival political factions.
  • BJP leader Parvesh Verma denied the allegations and countered that AAP is using the incident for political gain.
  • The Delhi Police have been called to investigate the matter.

“This attack is an embarrassment to democracy, and we will not tolerate such acts,” stated an AAP spokesperson.

This incident raises concerns about political violence and the safety of public figures in the current political landscape.
newTitle: Arvind Kejriwal's Car Attacked by BJP Workers: AAP Responds
